alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 2:23PM MDT until April 21 at 5:08PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in South Dakota... Elm River at Westport affecting Brown County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elm River at Westport. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Several gravel roads along the river begin to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM CDT Monday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage tomorrow evening to 13.6 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then rise above flood stage Wednesday morning to 16.4 feet Thursday morning. It will fall below flood stage again early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening by 1130 PM CDT.
